text:
I am in general glad for AD theorists.
they don’t , as a rule, do things that are useful though.

But I can sleep better knowing they  have proved that things we do are internally consistent; and possible.

elements.text:
I am in general glad for AD theorists.
they don’t , as a rule, do things that are useful though.

But I can sleep better knowing they  have proved that things we do are internally consistent; and possible.

text:
For example AFAICT this paper actually doesn’t work on numbers, at all, ever.
It generalizes the idea of a number enough that a string is a number,
Then defines AD on strings.

This includes relaxing the requirment of a vector space to a commutative semiring.
Which drops the requirement for continuousness.

Its cool.
I am just not sure that that is a useful thing to do.
Or interesting in particular to anyone interested in practical AD.
